content.question: Increases in the amount of money spent on national defense and security contracts, such as those that occurred after the 9/11 terrorist attacks and during the subsequent wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, would most likely have which of the following consequences?

choices.label: There would be an increase in the number of ideological social movements that seek to influence the federal budget.
Defense contractors would increase their lobbying efforts in order to improve their chances of winning a contract.
A single-issue group would form to take out political ads opposing increased federal spending.
A political party realignment would occur, shifting more voters into the Democratic Party.

content.answer: Defense contractors would increase their lobbying efforts in order to improve their chances of winning a contract.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply to different scenarios in context.
